intro: Isoloma incurvum, commonly known as the curling isoloma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a rounded head. Isoloma incurvum is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
